Overview

This article provides a comprehensive guide on how to create and manage invoices in Netsuite for services such as mirror installation and training. It covers the process of creating an opportunity, filling out necessary information, and the steps to follow after receiving a signed contract or purchase order.

Information

This guide focuses on the process of creating and managing invoices in Netsuite, specifically for services like mirror installation and training. It provides step-by-step instructions for creating an opportunity, filling out required fields, and handling the process after receiving a signed contract.

How to Create an Opportunity

To create an opportunity in Netsuite:

  1. Log in to Netsuite using your "TIV Project Manager CEUR or UK or US (CRM)" role.
  2. Hover over "Transactions/Sales" and click on "Create Opportunity".
  3. Fill in all necessary information in the new opportunity form.

Primary Information

The Primary Information section includes important fields such as:

  • Custom Form (do not change)
  • Opportunity Name
  • End User
  • Customer
  • Partner
  • Comments For Invoicing
  • Status
  • Probability
  • Expected Close Date
  • Action Item
  • Area of use
  • Invoice Text
  • PO#
  • Terms of Payment

Additional Information

After filling in the Primary Information, complete the following sections:

  • Classification
  • Contract
  • Forecasting

These sections include fields such as Subsidiary, Contract Start/End Date, Order Type, Contract Term, Project Total, and Dropbox Link for the signed contract.

Item Section

In the Item section, fill out the following fields:

  • Item (e.g., T2002 for mirror, T2013 for training)
  • Description
  • Quantity
  • Unit Price

Post-Contract Steps

After receiving the signed contract or purchase order:

  1. Update all necessary information in the opportunity.
  2. Set the opportunity status to "Closed Won".
  3. Wait for PS Ops to create a sales order.
  4. Create a project from the sales order.
  5. Connect the project to the opportunity.
  6. Ensure the correct billing address is listed.
  7. Notify Anna that the opportunity should be released.

FAQ

What role do I need to create an opportunity in Netsuite?

You need the "TIV Project Manager CEUR or UK or US (CRM)" role to create an opportunity in Netsuite.

Where should I upload the signed contract?

Upload the signed contract to the corresponding client folder in the Dropbox shared folder for Professional Services Customer Projects.

What happens after I set the opportunity status to "Closed Won"?

Globals PS Ops (Anna Grunde or Global sales Ops Giulia Di Padova) will receive an automated email and create a sales order for the opportunity.
